intro: Cryptantha leucophaea, commonly known as the white-flowered cryptantha, is a flowering plant native to the western United States. It belongs to the Boraginaceae family and is characterized by its delicate, blue to violet flowers that bloom in late spring. The plant typically grows in open, sunny habitats such as grasslands and rocky slopes. It has small, hairy leaves and produces small, capsule-like fruits that contain several seeds. Cryptantha leucophaea is often found in arid or semi-arid regions and is adapted to thrive in nutrient-poor soils.
